cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8.8)
project(BoostFilesystem CXX)

include(Ryppl)

ryppl_find_and_use_package(BoostSystem)
include_directories(include)

add_library(boost_filesystem
  src/operations.cpp
  src/path.cpp
  src/portability.cpp
  src/utf8_codecvt_facet.cpp
  src/codecvt_error_category.cpp
  src/path_traits.cpp
  src/unique_path.cpp
  src/windows_file_codecvt.cpp
  )

if(NOT BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)
  set_target_properties(boost_filesystem PROPERTIES
    PREFIX "lib"
    )
endif(NOT BUILD_SHARED_LIBS)

target_link_libraries(boost_filesystem
  boost_system
  )

#ryppl_add_test_subdirectory(test)


ryppl_export(
  TARGETS
    boost_filesystem
  DEPENDS
    BoostConfig
    BoostCore
#     BoostFunctionalHash
#     BoostIO
#     BoostInteger
#     BoostIterator
#     BoostSmartPtr
#     BoostStaticAssert
    BoostSystem
#     BoostTypeTraits
#     BoostUtility
  INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
    include
  )

# gerardus: Primarly, we need to generate DLLs for the boost libraries
# so that they can be linked into MEX files. However, CMake for
# Windows doesn't seem to know how to link executables to the DLLs,
# which means that we have to generate additional static libraries too
if(WIN32 AND NOT CYGWIN)
  add_library(boost_filesystemlib
    STATIC
    src/operations.cpp
    src/path.cpp
    src/portability.cpp
    src/utf8_codecvt_facet.cpp
    src/codecvt_error_category.cpp
    src/path_traits.cpp
    src/unique_path.cpp
    src/windows_file_codecvt.cpp
    )
  set_target_properties(boost_systemlib PROPERTIES
    OUTPUT_NAME "boost_filesystem"
    )
  
  ryppl_export(
    TARGETS
    boost_filesystemlib
    DEPENDS
    BoostConfig
    BoostCore
    #     BoostFunctionalHash
    #     BoostIO
    #     BoostInteger
    #     BoostIterator
    #     BoostSmartPtr
    #     BoostStaticAssert
    BoostSystem
    #     BoostTypeTraits
    #     BoostUtility
    INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
    include
    )
endif()
